entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.25.0
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

  • This release adds a powerful new feature: you can now optionally save metadata and cover images directly into EPUB files.
  • This is particularly useful if you’re transferring books to an e-reader, as the updated metadata and cover will be visible on your device.
  • Before writing changes to the file, Booklore can also create a backup of the original embedded metadata and cover (configurable via the UI).
  • If needed, you can easily restore the original metadata and cover later from the metadata viewer page.

entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.27.0
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

This release brings some great quality-of-life improvements I’m excited to share. Metadata updates are now fully reactive and real-time. When you trigger a fetch, updates stream in immediately, no need to refresh or guess if anything changed. You can now edit metadata for multiple books, either in bulk or individually in a streamlined interface. It’s a lot more efficient and gives you precise control over your library. Also, original cover images are now embedded directly into EPUBs to ensure consistent display across all readers. Hope these updates make your library management smoother and more enjoyable!

🚀 Features

  • Make Metadata Fetching and Updates Fully Reactive and Real-Time (#536) by @adityachandelgit
  • Support Individual Metadata Editing for Multiple Books (#534) by @adityachandelgit
  • Support Editing Metadata for Multiple Books at Once via Bulk Edit Int… (#531) by @adityachandelgit
  • Embed original cover image in EPUB metadata (#529) by @adityachandelgit

entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.28.0
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

This release adds some awesome new features that take Booklore’s library management to the next level. You can now track your reading progress with Read Status, filter books based on what you’ve read, and rate them using your own personal rating system. Managing multiple books is easier than ever with Shift+Click selection and a new Select All option for bulk actions. Admins can now delete books directly from the UI, a long-requested feature that’s now fully permission-controlled. These updates are designed to give you more control, better organization, and a smoother, more personalized experience.

  • Add Read Status tracking and filtering support (#553) by @adityachandelgit
